alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Warren (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 16 at 2:50PM CDT until July 16 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT FOR FRANKLIN AND SOUTHEASTERN WARREN COUNTIES... At 249 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Marthasville to near Sullivan, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Washington, Union, Warrenton, Sullivan, Pacific, St. Clair, Wright City, Gray Summit, Villa Ridge, Marthasville, Truesdale, Innsbrook, Parkway, Miramiguoa Park, Beaufort, Treloar, Dutzow, Lonedell, Foristell, and Leslie. This also includes Robertsville State Park and Meramec State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 in Missouri between exits 225 and 257. Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 193 and 200. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
